metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1516 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
OpenCV 3.0.0 has a double free issue that allows attackers to executearbitrary code.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1516` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libcv2.4 - 2.4.9.1+dfsg-1.5ubuntu1.1
libcvaux2.4 - 2.4.9.1+dfsg-1.5ubuntu1.1
libhighgui2.4 - 2.4.9.1+dfsg-1.5ubuntu1.1
libopencv-calib3d2.4v5 - 2.4.9.1+dfsg-1.5ubuntu1.1
libopencv-contrib2.4v5 - 2.4.9.1+dfsg-1.5ubuntu1.1
libopencv-core2.4v5 - 2.4.9.1+dfsg-1.5ubuntu1.1
libopencv-features2d2.4v5 - 2.4.9.1+dfsg-1.5ubuntu1.1
libopencv-flann2.4v5 - 2.4.9.1+dfsg-1.5ubuntu1.1
libopencv-gpu2.4v5 - 2.4.9.1+dfsg-1.5ubuntu1.1
libopencv-highgui2.4v5 - 2.4.9.1+dfsg-1.5ubuntu1.1
libopencv-imgproc2.4v5 - 2.4.9.1+dfsg-1.5ubuntu1.1
libopencv-legacy2.4v5 - 2.4.9.1+dfsg-1.5ubuntu1.1
libopencv-ml2.4v5 - 2.4.9.1+dfsg-1.5ubuntu1.1
libopencv-objdetect2.4v5 - 2.4.9.1+dfsg-1.5ubuntu1.1
libopencv-ocl2.4v5 - 2.4.9.1+dfsg-1.5ubuntu1.1
libopencv-photo2.4v5 - 2.4.9.1+dfsg-1.5ubuntu1.1
libopencv-stitching2.4v5 - 2.4.9.1+dfsg-1.5ubuntu1.1
libopencv-superres2.4v5 - 2.4.9.1+dfsg-1.5ubuntu1.1
libopencv-ts2.4v5 - 2.4.9.1+dfsg-1.5ubuntu1.1
libopencv-video2.4v5 - 2.4.9.1+dfsg-1.5ubuntu1.1
libopencv-videostab2.4v5 - 2.4.9.1+dfsg-1.5ubuntu1.1
libopencv2.4-java - 2.4.9.1+dfsg-1.5ubuntu1.1
libopencv2.4-jni - 2.4.9.1+dfsg-1.5ubuntu1.1
opencv-data - 2.4.9.1+dfsg-1.5ubuntu1.1
python-opencv - 2.4.9.1+dfsg-1.5ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: opencv package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.9.1+dfsg-1.5ubuntu1.1').
